Class Polynomial

java.lang.Object
Polynomial
public class Polynomial extends Object
Represents a variable degree polynomial

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Polynomial()
    Constructs an empty polynomial with a default degree of 3
    Polynomial(int degree)
    Constructs an empty polynomial with a specified degree

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    double
    evaluate(double x)
    Evaluates the polynomial expression, substituting a given value for x Assumes that all coefficients are already set

    Returns the coefficient at the given index, or null if it is still unset

    Returns the degree of the polynomial

    Sets the coefficient at the given index

    Returns a string of the polynomial expression in standard form: Ax^N + Bx^(N - 1) + ...
    String

      Constructs an empty polynomial with a specified degree

  • Method Details

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string of the polynomial expression in standard form: Ax^N + Bx^(N - 1) + ... + Cx + D Replaces coefficients with a variable if unset (As there are only 26 letters, the degree should not be higher)
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      String - Polynomial expression in standard form

    • getDegree

      public int getDegree()
      Returns the degree of the polynomial
      Returns:
      int - Degree of the polynomial

    • getCoefficient

      public Integer getCoefficient(int coefficientIdx)
      Returns the coefficient at the given index, or null if it is still unset
      Parameters:
      coefficientIdx - Index of the coefficient to get
      Returns:
      Integer - Coefficient at the given index

    • setCoefficient

      public void setCoefficient(int coefficientIdx, Integer coefficient)
      Sets the coefficient at the given index
      Parameters:
      coefficientIdx - Index of the coefficient to set
      coefficient - Coefficient to set

    • evaluate

      public double evaluate(double x)
      Evaluates the polynomial expression, substituting a given value for x Assumes that all coefficients are already set
      Parameters:
      x - Value to substitute in for x
      Returns:
      double - Result of evaluating the polynomial expression

    • visualizeGraph

      public String visualizeGraph(int width, int height, double minX, double maxX, double minY, double maxY)
      Returns a string of a visualization of the polynomial graph using ASCII characters, generated with the given options
      Parameters:
      width - The width of the visualization
      height - The height of the visualization
      minX - The minimum x value of the visualization
      maxX - The maximum x value of the visualization
      minY - The minimum y value of the visualization
      mayY - The maximum y value of the visualization
      Returns:
      String - Visualization of the polynomial graph
